subject: AI & Agents
title: Stereo Vision: Depth from Two Cameras
description: Learn Stereo Vision: Depth from Two Cameras in one minute.

hook.text: Close one eye: flat world. Open both: depth perception. Stereo vision gives cameras the same trick.

buildup.text: Two cameras capture the same scene from slightly different angles, like human eyes.

discovery.text: Matching pixels between views reveals disparityâ€”the shift encodes distance to each point.

twist.text: Textureless surfaces (white walls, glass) have no features to match, creating depth holes.

climax.text: Modern stereo combines classical matching with deep learning to fill these gaps.

punchline.text: Two views beat one. Depth emerges from difference.

quiz.question: How does stereo vision estimate depth?
options: By comparing pixel shifts between two camera views
